Text.Value: You could hold off a horde of goblins from this position.
I'm guessing you have plenty of both - be nice if I could say the same for myself.
I'm not really keen on fighting or praying.
I haven't seen a single goblin. That's good, isn't it?
It was you, wasn't it? You saved us. Thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: in awe - we're heroes to her. Just saved her life

Text.Value: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.

EditorData.NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Text.Value: If a few goblins scare you, you don't deserve to survive.
Don't worry too much. A handful of powerful spells go a long way.
A few goblins? Felt like a lot more to me.
'Digging their graves'? Why not pass out daggers to stick themselves with, while you're at it?
You could try praying.
We need an army, not a hunter. There could be hundreds of them out there.
Maybe - but we're not fighters. If they broke through, it'd be a massacre.
You're scared of a few goblins? Pathetic.
Tactics are more important than training.
Hundreds? Urgh, it'll take hours to kill them all. She's right, we should just go.
I've carved up goblins from here to inner Chult. We will overcome, whatever the odds.
I've torn demons apart with my bare hands. Goblins won't be a problem.
You think? That's something at least. We're not trained fighters though...
Still here? Thought you'd have abandoned us by now.
There could be thousands. But they'd lose their nerve if we found the right weak spot.
So, yes. I'm scared. And I'm not ashamed of that.
Cold bastard.

EditorData.NodeContext: not mocking the player or meaning to put them down (they just told her they were hunters) but not convinced they can help

Text.Value: Why not take your chances on the road?
Leave.
If I see a goblin, I'm closing this gate - whether you're inside or not.

EditorData.NodeContext: doesn't mean to be cruel, but she really will lock you out - very matter of fact

Text.Value: If the road was clear? A tenday's walk, maybe. But while the goblins are out there, it might as well be the other side of the world.

EditorData.NodeContext: first lines thoughtful - then sadness after 'travel'

Text.Value: Best get to digging your own graves then.
I will soon be kith'rak. I am an army.
Leave.
The sooner we leave for Baldur's Gate, the better.
Let them come. This position favours the defender.
We might have to. But I'd feel better if we at least knew how many are out there.

EditorData.NodeContext: agreeing with the player, but still anxious

Text.Value: Goblins aren't hunters - they're prey. I'll kill every last one.
How far are we from the city?
There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.
It'd be even nicer if we were on the road to Baldur's Gate already.

Synopsis: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.
